name: Primary Production / Algal Indicators
functionStatement: Organic matter is captured and broken down, fueling food webs, balancing production/ respiration, moderating pH/ redox, and supplying nutrients.
descriptionMarkdown: Balanced algae/macrophyte growth, no nuisance blooms, unless moderate coverage is historically normal.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Use chlorophyll or periphyton data where available. If absent, infer risk from nutrients and light conditions.

inputs.label: Primary Production / Algal Indicators
inputs.helpMarkdown: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Balanced growth with no nuisance blooms. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Slightly elevated algae. / Frequent moderate nuisance mats. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Thick blooms or scums that cover substrate. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.39)

references: EPA Water Quality Portal (chlorophyll-a/periphyton where available)
